{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Buffalo |model=WHR-AMG54 |revision= |availability=Japan only |type=wireless router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_poe= |est_release_date=08/2005 |manuf=CyberTAN |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM5351G;BCM5351GKPB, HT0529 P11, 748513 NA; |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM638165TS-7 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |serial=yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL |jtag= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4318;BCM4318KFBG, HA0532 P11, 751378 N2A; |wi1_chip2_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip2_model=BCM2060 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ch= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }}[http://buffalo.jp/products/catalog/item/w/whr-amg54/ Product page (JP)] [http://www.wifi.com.cn/backup/2-wifi/buffalo-whr-amg54.html On wifi.com.cn] (internal images) :"WHR4-AG54A REV: XC" and a date code of '''0542''' is silkscreened on the board. ::The format would seem to indicate '''CyberTAN''' manuf {{TechInfoDepot|Buffalo_WHR-AMG54}}
[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=24153 On the OpenWrt forums] Per the [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Supported_Devices DD-WRT Supported Devices table], you can use the WHR-HP-G54 firmware.
